title: Does anyone actually enjoy the music of The Cure?
self_text: I've been listening to them for years, and it just sounds like a miserable man screaming into a microphone. Why do other people love them?

title: Do you think the government is doing everything they can to keep us from knowing the truth?
self_text: I'm just asking for an opinion, but it seems like a lot of people are saying that the government is hiding something, and I'm not sure if they are right or wrong, but there seem to be a lot of things that have been hidden away.

title: How do you get a good tan in winter?
self_text: I live in the UK and it is extremely cold here, so tanning is not really an option. So I was wondering how you can get a tan during winter, even if it's just a slight tan?

title: Why does my friend have an apple for a phone background?
self_text: It's not a picture of an apple, it's just a photo of the word Apple in big letters and red colors. I don't know why he likes that so much.   I guess you could say I'm kinda jealous of his style.  He doesn't own an iPhone either, which is weird because he uses it all day long.

title: Why are we so bad at measuring things?
self_text: When you're using a ruler, it seems like the measurement is always off by a little bit. How do you measure something accurately without a tool?

title: What is the biggest problem with a lot of American culture?
self_text: A lot of Americans have no respect for others and do not try to find common ground with those that are different from them.

title: Why is the USA so behind on developing new medicines?
self_text: I just read that in the UK, they have a lot of money and people to work on drugs and medicine but US doesn't. Is it because of politics? Or is there something else?

title: Why do people say that the first thing you should do when someone dies is to call the family?
self_text: Is there a reason why it's said like that, or just something that has been passed down through generations?

title: Why does everyone think that the US is so bad?
self_text: I'm not saying the US is perfect, but why do people always complain about it? The only thing I see is a country with great healthcare and education system, some of the best food in the world and a huge diversity of cultures.  I've been to Europe and they all seem pretty depressing and grey. And let me tell you, there are plenty of places on Earth where people live with less than $2/day. What’s the big deal?

title: Why are there so many more people in the USA than in Europe?
self_text: I know that Europe is much older and has been inhabited for longer, but still... why does the population of the US exceed that of Europe by so much?  I’m thinking about it as a whole, not just the countries of Europe.  It's like the US is growing at an insane rate compared to the rest of the world.

title: Why does my phone keep saying "untrusted device" when I try to connect it with a new computer?
self_text: I just bought a new computer and I want to use the Bluetooth feature of my phone on that new computer but every time I try, my phone says “Untrusted device”. I’ve tried clicking “Pair anyway” and then “Trust this device”, but it doesn't work. It asks for an authorization code which I don't know what is. My phone is Android 12 and my computer is Windows 10. Is there anything else I can do?

title: Can you get a tattoo on your arm that is not visible by simply wearing long sleeves?
self_text: My friend said he was going to get a tattoo on his left arm and then cover it up with long sleeves.  I thought, “Okay that’s cool” but I was wondering if there are any ways he could do it so it wouldn't be too obvious when he removed the sleeve.

title: Does it matter how much money you have when you buy something?
self_text: I always find myself buying more stuff than I need, but if I am not sure how much to spend on something, then I end up paying too much.

title: Why does the amount of time spent on a job determine how much you make?
self_text: Like if I spend less than 10 hours per week, it is not worth my time and therefore, I should get paid less. The more hours you put in, the more money you earn.  How would that work?

title: How is it that when someone says they've been in the military, we always assume they have seen combat?
self_text: Not saying people who haven't seen combat aren't brave or good, just seems like most people are assuming that if you served you've done something dangerous

title: Is there a way to make the text in my photos look more like how it looks on my phone?
self_text: I have been trying to edit pictures and they always come out looking blurry or weird, so I've been trying to find ways to fix them but I don't know what I'm doing, so any tips would be helpful!  I am using Adobe Photoshop and can't afford to pay for subscription services.

title: What is the difference between a high-rise and low rise apartment building?
self_text: Are they different names for buildings that are just tall or short, or do they have specific characteristics?

title: Why do people get so worked up about the weather?
self_text: When I was a kid, my dad used to tell me "Don't be sad when it rains" or "You can't change what happens" but when he was talking about it, he would be visibly upset, like if something really bad happened. It's not that it is actually bad but you know the rain will ruin your plans and then there's the mud puddles that are hard to avoid. People seem to get so annoyed at the weather and how it changes things. I just don't understand why everyone gets so angry about it.

title: Why does a lot of the internet consider “the right” to be evil?
self_text: I just don't understand what they find wrong with people who think that it is okay for a government to have power over its citizens, and how those in power can be held accountable by the voters.

title: What do I do with my leftovers?
self_text: So, I just cooked a big meal and had a great time cooking it for my family. Now there are so many leftovers that I don't know what to do with them. I could eat them but they aren't as good the next day. Is it ok to freeze them? Can I put them in the fridge and eat them tomorrow? If so how long can I keep them? Should I throw them out?

title: What does “being an adult” mean?
self_text: So I’m turning 20 next year and my parents still treat me like a kid (like giving me chores and stuff). My friends are all getting jobs, going to college, moving out of their parents houses and they're having fun.  I just don’t understand what it means to be an adult. Am I gonna get to the point where I can afford to live on my own or am I always gonna need my mom to pay for stuff?

title: How to keep my hair from falling out?
self_text: I'm 24 and starting to lose a lot of hair on the front, like my bangs are coming off my forehead. It seems like I am losing a bunch of hair in general. My mom says that she had a similar thing happen when she was younger and it eventually stopped but I'm worried about what could be causing this.

title: How many calories in a 300g chicken breast?
self_text: Can you help me find out how many calories are in a 300g chicken breast? I can't find the answer anywhere and I don't want to guess.  I'm trying to calculate my daily caloric intake.

title: Does a new phone have to be connected to Wi-Fi before it is unlocked?
self_text: I just bought a new phone and when I go to unlock it, it says “Connect to Wifi” but my phone has no wifi connection at the moment. Should I wait until I get home and connect to Wi-Fi before unlocking it or can I do so without?

title: How do I tell my landlord that I'm not going to be able to pay rent on time?
self_text: My dog just got sick and I've been in vet bills for a few days now, so I'm short $100 right now and can't make it by the end of the month. I plan on paying her back as soon as possible but i want to let her know before its too late.   Is there anything you guys would recommend?  (I have a good relationship with my landlord)

title: Why do some people hate the song "We Didn't Start the Fire" by Billy Joel?
self_text: I just watched a YouTube video of it and I don't understand why so many people hate it. It's catchy, has a lot of interesting historical facts in it, and is just a fun song to listen to.  It doesn't seem like anyone can dislike this song (besides maybe those who are against music in general)

title: How can I tell if a guy is into me?
self_text: I’m kind of new to dating and I have no idea how to read signals in person. So i was hoping you guys could help me out!

title: Does the number of ways to say something matter?
self_text: Do you need a good or creative way to say something in order for it to be better than others? I mean, is there such thing as a better/worse way to say something?

title: Why do we call it a “brain freeze” when you eat something cold too fast?
self_text: Does the freezing of your brain actually cause a physical pain, or is that just how it feels to us?

title: Is it a good idea to use the same password for everything?
self_text: I know this is probably bad advice but I have been using the same password on all my accounts and I haven't had any issues yet. Would it be better to create different passwords for each account, or should I keep doing what I am currently doing?

title: Why does the United States have so many states?
self_text: Like, why not just a few big states? The UK has England, Scotland, Wales and Northern Ireland, but they're all fairly small.  I don’t understand the US system of having such distinct states with their own laws and governments. Does anyone know what led to that?

title: How do I make a perfect chicken roast?
self_text: Chicken is something that I really want to learn how to cook but I never know what to do to ensure it comes out perfect and juicy. Also, any specific tips or tricks for making sure the meat doesn't dry out during roasting?

title: Do people who work with a lot of machines ever feel like their hands are going to be damaged?
self_text: I can't seem to get my hands to stop getting sore after working on them all day, so I am starting to worry about the long term damage that could occur.  I'm not asking for medical advice, just wondering if this is normal.

title: What is the most popular brand of cigarettes in the US?
self_text: I'm not a smoker but my brother is and he has mentioned to me that Marlboro is the most popular, and also Virginia Slims is pretty popular as well. Is this true or just his opinion?

title: How do you know if your friend is lying?
self_text: I think my friend is lying to me, but they are a very good liar and it's hard to tell. They have always been like that since we were kids. Any advice on how to find out?

title: What happens to all of the things that are in the trash?
self_text: I was walking down the street and saw a trash can overflowing with garbage. I thought about taking some of it, but then I realized it would probably be illegal and I'd get arrested.  What happens to all of the things that are thrown away? Do they go to landfills? Are they recycled? Do they just disappear? If they’re going to landfills, how long do they last before they become toxic?

title: What is the difference between a "coke" and a "cola"?
self_text: I've heard people use these two terms interchangeably, but they are not the same thing?

title: How does a microwave oven work?
self_text: Does it have a magnetron, or some other device that can create microwaves? If so, how does it turn electricity into microwaves? And what is the purpose of the rotating turntable?

title: How can I make my hair look like it’s been cut by a professional?
self_text: My hair is just so boring and unshaped, but I don't have money to go to the salon, and I am very bad at cutting my own hair. I’ve tried using Youtube tutorials for years but they never work out. What do you guys think would be the best way to improve my hair shape without going to the salon?

title: Why do they call it the “weekend”?
self_text: I am just wondering why we have the word weekend to describe a day when people are free and can relax? Why not something more descriptive like “day of leisure” or “time for fun”?

title: Why did the US not make a big deal about the 2016 election?
self_text: I'm asking because people on Reddit have mentioned it and there are lots of claims that it was very bad for democracy, but why didn't everyone in the US care about it? Or how did they just move on with their lives after it happened?

title: What is the difference between a black hole and a white hole?
self_text: I am not a physicist so please answer in simple terms.

title: How to stop being an idiot?
self_text: I have been called an idiot many times, and now that I am older it is a lot harder for me to stop thinking about what people think of me. It’s like if I make a stupid mistake or say something dumb, I start overthinking everything I do. How can I just stop doing the wrong thing so people don’t call me an idiot?

title: How much is the price of a single cup of coffee in South Korea?
self_text: I am visiting South Korea for a few weeks and want to try all their different types of coffee, but I don't know how expensive they are so I can save money on my trip.

title: How do I make a good and tasty sourdough bread?
self_text: My friends are always making some really nice breads and want to try to teach me how to bake them, but it seems like so much work.

title: If you're really good at something, are you obligated to teach others?
self_text: Not like a teacher or anything, just help out people who want to learn from you. Like if I know how to play the guitar, should I tell someone that and show them how to play it?

title: How to stop a person from being rude?
self_text: I don't know how to deal with people who are rude and/or mean to me in public. Like if someone is just talking down at you or making snide comments it can be really frustrating and make you feel bad about yourself. Do you have any tips on dealing with them?

title: How to make a good ice cream?
self_text: Is it better to use heavy cream or milk when making ice cream?

title: Why is the "new normal" always so bad?
self_text: I was thinking about how every new thing that comes out is bad, like Covid, political polarization, etc. It's as if humans are just drawn to things that go wrong and then try to fix them (which usually doesn't work). Is there a reason why we have such a hard time embracing change?

title: What is the point of a "non-alcoholic" beer?
self_text: I am talking about the beers that look and taste like alcohol, but have no actual alcohol in them. Like when you go to a bar and they're offering a “beer” for people who don’t drink? Is it just to make some money off people who are trying to be more responsible? Or does it have some other reason?  What if someone wants to have fun with their friends at a party and they don't want to drink alcohol? Would they still be able to enjoy themselves without drinking something that looks like beer?

title: Why is the name of the town in which the first public library was built, “The Library” (as opposed to something more descriptive)
self_text: I remember reading somewhere that The Library was the first public library in the US and it was located in a small town called "The Library." So why did they just call it “The Library”?

title: Why is it called a "tuna" when the fish is shaped like a triangle?
self_text: I’ve seen tuna before, and they look like a triangle. So why do we call them “tuna”? It seems weird to me.

title: Why do some people think that eating more calories will make you gain weight?
self_text: I've heard people say that eating more calories is the reason they are gaining weight, but I feel like if you eat more calories than you burn then you will lose weight. How does eating more calories cause you to gain weight?

title: What is the most interesting thing that has happened to you recently?
self_text: I'm in my late teens and just graduated highschool. I want to know if there are any interesting things that have been going on in your life lately, maybe something like a weird experience or an amazing opportunity?

title: What's the best way to do a home renovation with no budget?
self_text: I need to renovate my home but I have no money and can only do it myself.

title: Why do they call them “black holes”?
self_text: What is a black hole?  Is it called a black hole because of its appearance or something else? I’m just curious!

title: Why is it that when you see a woman wearing a dress and heels, she’s almost always considered beautiful?
self_text: I know there are other factors involved, but if a man wears a suit and dress shoes he's often seen as arrogant or trying too hard. How do women get away with looking more feminine than men?

title: How does the term "narcissistic" apply to people who are just not that good at making friends?
self_text: I've been thinking about how some people seem like they’re really bad at making friends, and it makes me wonder if they might have narcissistic tendencies. For example, someone is always talking about themselves, never listens to others, and is overly critical of everyone else. It seems like these behaviors could be signs of narcissism but i don’t think that’s necessarily true either

title: How can I tell if my dog is lying to me?
self_text: My dog will act happy when I am home and then when I leave he looks sad. He's a very smart dog, he knows when I'm leaving so how can I tell if he's really sad or just playing around?

title: Why is it so hard to get a job in retail?
self_text: I just got laid off from my retail job because of the economy, but I've been applying for jobs and getting rejected or not hearing back. I know it's not the best job out there and that people leave for better ones all the time, but I'm pretty sure that's not the case here. My resume looks good, I have references, and I'm friendly with my coworkers. It's just really hard to find a place where I can work, and I don't understand why.  I used to have an easier time finding a job before and I was only working part-time. Now that I want a full-time job I am stuck.  What do you guys think?

title: Is there a way to get rid of the smell on a dog that has been in the rain?
self_text: My dog got caught in the rain and now smells like wet dog. I have tried everything from drying him off, using towels and even spraying him with a special dog spray but nothing seems to work. It’s really starting to bother me because he is my best friend and I don't want to be around his smell.  I am looking for tips on how to help him get rid of the smell so it doesn’t linger as long as it does. Do you guys know anything about this?

title: How to stop a dog from barking at the mailman?
self_text: I have a dog who barks at the mailman all day. He is not aggressive, just excited and wants attention. It's annoying me as the mailman is now avoiding my house.  How do I make him stop?

title: Why do people say "there's no such thing as a free lunch"
self_text: I was just thinking about the saying "There is no such thing as a free lunch."  It seems like that saying has become kind of cliché, but why?   And what does it mean exactly? Does anyone have an actual good answer to this question?   Is there any evidence that shows if this saying is actually true?

title: What is the highest rated video game of all time?
self_text: Like, not just by critics but by players who have played it for a long time and enjoy it.

title: How do you know when to stop?
self_text: I am not a professional, but my doctor said that if I stopped taking the medicine for too long, it could make things worse. But he also said that if I kept taking it for too long, it could cause some issues. What are some good ways to know when to stop taking something that is supposed to help me out in some way?

title: Why do some people have a really hard time with math?
self_text: I'm just curious, is it something that can be fixed or is there anything to do about it?

title: Why is it that when people are getting a new haircut, they're always like "I don't know what I want" but then they come out looking amazing?
self_text: Do you guys think the person getting the haircut has any idea how they want to look after the cut?

title: Why do they put these weird green things on the side of the road?
self_text: The weird green thing that I see in every city is always a little annoying, I don't know why it's there and what it does.  Is it supposed to deter drivers from speeding or something?

title: Why does the US still have so many different types of currency?
self_text: I mean, like, why aren't we just all using the same thing? Or even a digital form of currency? We do not need to have dollar bills, coins, and cards, or whatever. I think it would make everything easier for people who are trying to shop or pay their taxes.

title: Why is it so difficult to get a good quality leather bag?
self_text: I was looking at the online shop and they are selling these bags for $800+ dollars but when you look at them closely, there is some obvious imperfections. It’s like they don't care about their products.

title: How do you know if a person is racist?
self_text: I have a friend who said something that really bothered me and I don't want to be wrong about it. What are some things that indicate someone may be racist or prejudiced?  I want to make sure I am not jumping to conclusions, but I also need to protect myself from people who might be harmful to me.

title: How can I get my cat to stop biting me?
self_text: My cat, Mr. Fluffernutter (a very fancy name for a normal tabby) loves to bite my hands and feet when I'm petting him. It’s not like he’s playing with me or something; it feels more like he is trying to hurt me. He does this at least once per day, but sometimes multiple times. Does anyone know how to make this behavior go away?

title: How do you know that something is real?
self_text: Like, I can't prove to someone I am not a robot. You can't prove you are human either. What makes something real? Or does it even matter what we consider real?

title: Is there a way to make my hair look like it’s been in the sun for hours?
self_text: I have really dark brown hair and it looks like it’s been bleached by the sun when it actually has not. I just went out for an hour or two and now I’m wondering if I should go get a sun-in or something, or if I can achieve this effect with my current routine?   I don't want to damage my hair though, so any tips would be appreciated.

title: Why is it always better to be the first person you know to do something?
self_text: Do you think that if you are the first person you know to do something, then it's generally more rewarding than if someone else has already done it?

title: Why do people who play games like Minecraft have such a strong sense of ownership?
self_text: Like, when someone makes a build that looks cool, they say things like "I built this" or "This is my base". I just don't understand why they feel the need to brag about something that’s in a game and has no real-world impact.

title: Why do people who are extremely religious have a hard time with science?
self_text: Not just the scientific method, but even basic things like gravity and how things work in nature. They don't understand why there is so much variation in the world. I know that they should be able to accept all of it if they believe in God. It makes me wonder what would happen if the world was more populated by atheists?

title: Why do people like to use the term “woke” as a derogatory term?
self_text: I’ve seen many people using the term “woke” with a negative connotation, and I’m curious why they do so.  I’m not saying that being aware of social injustices is bad but what is wrong with wanting to be a good person and stand up for those less fortunate? It seems like it's become such a loaded word now that it can't be used without someone attacking you.

title: Does it matter if I’m not a doctor to give medical advice?
self_text: I was just talking with my friend and he asked me for some advice on how to treat his cold. He said that I gave him the best advice and he told me that he felt better after doing what I said. Is giving advice like this considered giving medical advice? If so, does that mean that I could be held liable for anything that happens to him because of my advice?

title: Why are people so concerned about being called a racist?
self_text: I can’t be the only one that thinks it’s ridiculous when someone gets offended over something they said or did. Like, if you didn’t mean to offend anyone then why would you get mad?  It's just that some people use racial slurs in everyday conversation and don’t think twice about it, but once someone says something that might offend someone else they instantly get defensive.  I know there have been times where I accidentally used a term that may have offended others and I apologized for it. People seem to just want an apology and nothing more. If you say something bad, you should apologize for saying something bad. What am I missing here?

title: How do I get my dog to stop barking at the mailman?
self_text: It’s not like he actually wants to bite him or anything, he just barks and then runs to the window to watch him go by. I tried giving him a treat when he stops barking but it doesn’t work. He’s a pretty intelligent dog so I don't think it's because of the treats, I think it's just his habit. Any tips?

title: How many people are still using windows XP?
self_text: My brother still uses it and I can't believe that a computer is still running Windows XP in 2023. I'm not even sure if Microsoft supports the operating system anymore. What's stopping people from switching over to something else? Is it because they don't want to learn how to use another OS or do other things like security concerns? I just don't understand why people would be using something so outdated when there are much better options out there.

title: Does it matter what your name is in the United States?
self_text: I've always been told that my parents named me a name that was "unique" and didn't want me to be like other kids, so I have to use a different name than my birth name if I want to avoid being confused.  What about you? Are you called something else besides what your parents gave you when you were born?

title: How is it possible for a person to be married to two people at once?
self_text: I’ve read many articles and seen on TV that there are some countries where you can marry more than one person, but most of the time it's just a way to show how committed they are to each other. So is there any actual case where someone can have two wives or husbands?

title: Why do people hate on the word “slut”?
self_text: It’s just a word, it doesn't mean anything and I don't know why people are so harsh about it when they say it to other women. Like they are trying to hurt their feelings.

title: Is there a way to track the current price of Bitcoin?
self_text: I want to buy some bitcoin and don't know where to look for the current prices.  I looked on google but it was all about crypto shitcoins and other things.  Is there any reliable website that tracks the current price of bitcoin?

title: Why do some people have a really hard time with their parents?
self_text: This is just a general question for anyone who has experienced family issues. What are some things you can do to improve the relationship between yourself and your parents?

title: Why is it that in the United States, if someone says “I’m having a bad day” it is seen as an invitation to offer advice and/or sympathy?
self_text: I can say that I am having a bad day, but they just immediately start telling me how to fix my problems or tell me to go for a walk or something like that. I’ve never experienced this outside of the US. In Canada we don't do that. It’s weird.

title: How do you know if you're a bad person?
self_text: I've been thinking about it a lot lately, and I want to get some thoughts on this topic.  I don't think I'm a bad person but I often find myself doing things that are selfish or thoughtless of others.   Like last week I was arguing with my sister over who got the last slice of pizza, and when she said she wanted it more, I just grabbed it from her and ate it.  Or like yesterday, I was walking past a homeless man, and I didn't even bother to acknowledge him.  And there were other times where I was really rude to people because they annoyed me, but then I would feel guilty after and try to make up for it by doing something nice for them later.   I'm not trying to justify my actions, but I'm trying to understand why I do these things.  Am I a bad person?   Do I need to be nicer to people?   How can I stop doing this stuff?

title: Why do some people use the term "non-binary" to describe someone who is not exclusively male or female?
self_text: Is it just a lazy way of saying that they're not a man or a woman? Or does it have a different meaning, like that they can be both at times?

title: How do I know if a person is on drugs?
self_text: How can I tell if someone has been drinking or taking drugs, but they don't want to admit it and they are trying to hide it from me?

title: Is it okay to drink water when you have a cold?
self_text: I've been drinking a lot of water when I have a cold and I don't feel like my throat is dry, but I'm not sure if that's actually good for me.  I also have some electrolytes with my water as well so I get the benefits of both.

title: What’s the point of using a website to download files and then have to manually change them from .zip to .rar?
self_text: Is there any reason for websites to make you manually change your downloaded files from zip to rar? Or is it just laziness on their part?

title: What is the purpose of a “clean” or “normal” person?
self_text: I mean, what does it even mean to be clean and normal in society? Like, is that something you strive for? If so, why? And if not, then what are people doing instead? I don’t understand the idea of being “normal”. It makes me feel like I should try to fit into a mold or something. Is there any way to get out of it?

title: How to use a hammer?
self_text: I’m not asking how to hit something with it, I'm asking about what to do when you have a hammer and don’t know what you are doing with it

title: How do I find a good pizza place?
self_text: Like I just want to eat pizza for the rest of my life and never go hungry. If I'm going out somewhere, then I would like to make sure that they have pizza. There are lots of places with great food but it is hard to know where to go. What makes a good pizza place?

title: Why do some people get so angry when you call them “nigger” even if it’s not meant to be offensive?
self_text: I was talking with a friend about how we should start our own business and he said, "I would never want to be a nigger in America". I replied that it's just a word and not really an insult, but now he's giving me the silent treatment.

title: Does a cat like to be petted?
self_text: I have a friend who has a cat, and she always says her cat likes being petted, but I think her cat is just trying to get food from her. So I was wondering if cats generally enjoy being pet or not.

title: Can I be a bad person for having my own beliefs?
self_text: Are you saying that if someone has different beliefs from me, they're wrong and should be punished or killed? Do people who are evil have some type of innate ability to do so?  I have been trying to change my mindset, but it is not working.

title: Why is the US so weird?
self_text: I was in London for a few weeks and realized how weird Americans are, like we have our own customs that don't make sense to me.
